reviewText: I wondered how a DVD that focuses on the solar plexus might differ from Ravi and Ana's Navel Power workout. Whereas Navel Power strengthens  with lots of leg lifts and abdominal crunches, this DVD enlivens and stretches the solar plexus area in a variety of ways.I had knee surgery a few weeks ago and this is the first yoga I've done since then. I was worried it would be too taxing, but it's just thorough. Without overexerting myself, I feel great. Ravi and Ana suggest modifications, such as sitting cross legged if you can't sit on your heels.The music consists of mantras to uplift the spirit while you exercise. Ana explained a mantra I'd heard her sing on a prior DVD so we can all realize its benefits now. The setting is beautiful. The instructions are clear, informative and supportive. I learned, for example, that we have four diaphragms in our body: in the feet, pelvis, solar plexus and upper palate.My favorite part of the DVD was Ravi's profound instruction during the relaxation segment.
summary: Anyone can do this and feel better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this yoga DVD. A huge fan of the Ravianna series, this was my 6th video of theirs, and I think it might y new favorite. Focusing mostly on upper arm strength, abs, and glutes, what's great about this series is that it's very accessible, so you don't waste a lot of mental or physical energy being frustrated not knowing how to get into a position, or not being able to hold it with any kid of grace. It is also lighter on kegal exercises than most of their kundalini workouts, which I tend to appreciate. That's not to say to say it isn't challenging, you definitely still get a great workout, and an even better mental tune-in. I'm not usually one to care much about the music, but the music on this tape is really upbeat and uplifting.The one thing you might want to be aware of is that this tape is a little longer than some of the others, a true hour, which means that you might want to make sure you really have the time to go through it without worrying about getting somewhere or doing something. I think it is better for weekends than weeknights, overall.A+

reviewText: Great as all the genial DVDs of RAVIANA. They know how to make it simple and yet powerful. I recommend all their DVDs to everyone who want to change themselves and their lives!!

reviewText: NOTE: I received a free copy of this DVD to review for the web site Metapsychology Online Reviews; a more detailed version of my review appears on that site.Solar Power is a new releases from the husband/wife team of Ravi Singh and Ana Brett.  It features Solar Power features Ana practicing alone (against the painted lake scene backdrop used in their last set of DVD releases), while she and Ravi take turns providing voiceover instruction.  The exercises, which take place entirely on the floor, focus on the opening the area of the solar plexus.  Users will need only a mat (Ana's is placed vertically) to get started.The Main Menu of the DVD offers the following options:*Play DVD*Chapter Selections*Design Your Own Workout - Matrix Menu Options*Matrix Tutorial*Pre-Set SelectionsSelecting "Play All" leads with Ana's brief intro and then flows right into Tune In, a combination of meditation and the traditional opening chant "Ong Namo Guru Dev Namo."  This is followed by the first Solar Power set (13 minutes), which begins seated for spinal and neck rolls.  The next posture is lying on the back, one leg raised perpendicular to the ground, while performing breath of fire (BOF).  Then it's up to hands and knees for cat/cow, finishing by holding cow pose with BOF.  A brief rest in child's pose turns into "snaking cobra," a flowing move from child's to cobra and back again; this series ends by holding cobra with BOF.  This solar set concludes seated on the heels, first performing spinal flexes front and back, then spinal twists side-to-side.  Solar Power Part 2 (13.5 minutes) starts with some nice hip opening work, including seated cradle; Ana also performs half-lotus forward bend with BOF.  Next, she lies back for hip raises (pelvic tilts), moving into a full shoulderstand with BOF and continuing the BOF into plow.  The hip raises are repeated, and the segment finishes with abs work:  Ana starts in a full lying position and from here rises up into a modified boat pose, repeating at a moderate pace.The following segment, Set for Super Vitality (7 minutes) continues to target the abdominals.  Still lying on the back, Ana brings her straight legs up to a 45-degree angle and criss-crosses them rapidly at the calves; this exercise is repeated once.  Next, she performs a "parallel bicycle," which involves alternately bringing the knees in and out; this move is also repeated.  Two BOF exercises, each about 1 minute, conclude this set:  for the first, the hands are laced with the arms above the head, and for the second, the arms are bent behind the head, hands on opposite shoulders.  A longer set (15.5 minutes) called Awaken Your Senses follows.  Ana explains how to hold the hands in a mudra while chugging the arms like pistons and engaging in BOF, but she fails to mention that this exercise continues for about nine and a half minutes!  However, Ravi offers encouragement throughout as Sat Kartar sings a mantra in the background (several tracks from Kartar'sDaily PracticeCD are featured on this video).  But there's more:  continuing to hold the mudra, Ana moves her arms out to 90-degree angles, holding this position for another 4.5 minutes.  This set concludes with a few minutes of quiet meditation.Finally, it's time to relax with a nice, long (5 minutes) deep relaxation.  Prior to the Closing Prayer, there is a Heart Opening Mantra Chant (Ana sings this in the background of some of the previously-released DVDs); the words are Ra-a, Ma-a, Sa Sa Sa Sat, Hari Har Hari Har, and they provide a very soothing conclusion to the practice.  The brief Closing Prayer (1.5 minutes) brings the main practice in at around 65 minutes total.  However, following the credits, there is the option to go on to the Breath Primer (6.5 minutes) and the Posture Primer (6 minutes).Clicking on Pre-Set Selections from the Main Menu produces a sub-menu with these options:*Quick Set for Beginners (30 minutes)*Rise & Shine (58 minutes)*Solar Power Express (50 minutes)*Spiritual Uplift (63 minutes)I tend to practice mainly hatha yoga, but I enjoy incorporating Ravi and Ana's Kundalini as an occasional change of pace.  My favorite Ravi/Ana DVD so far has beenDance the Chakras Yoga Workout; to me, Solar Power has a somewhat similar feel in that the exercises are challenging yet doable and that it includes a singing mantra meditation.  Solar Power should certainly appeal to existing fans of this husband/wife team, and I would also recommend it to those with some prior hatha yoga experience who are interested in trying Kundalini for the first time.
summary: Joyful, uplifting Kundalini yoga practice focused on opening the solar plexus

reviewText: I can't say enough good about this DVD. I just finished doing it and it was wonderful! Beforehand, I was kind of stressed(who isn't these days) and after doing this workout I felt strengthened and balanced and more able to go with the flow of life rather than trying to change things I can't change. It gave me a release from holding onto stress and I felt above all the day's challenges...like they couldn't drag me down anymore. I think yoga(and especially Kundalini yoga) is even more important for people to do now days for their minds, bodies, and souls. It helps to ease your own suffering(and gives you a fit body to boot!). It helps you take charge of your mind and body. I've done many styles of yoga over the years and although I enjoy them all, I've found Kundalini to be the most healing physically, emotionally, and spiritually. I have experienced deep healing on all levels from Ana and Ravi's DVDs and each new DVD they make addresses another level of healing and health. Ana and Ravi have shown themselves to rise up to the needs of people with a Kundalini yoga that gives you the ancient wisdom and benefits and in a way that fits into your life. Since I started doing their yoga, I am calmer and more at peace and able to control my emotions. Also, it maintains my health and weight. I don't have to knock myself out at the gym...doing their yoga seriously has made it easy to be fit. I think because it works on the internal systems, rather than just on the outer body, it balances the body from the inside, so a fit body just comes naturally, because all the systems are brought into balance. I know many who have experienced the same thing. This DVD focuses on the solar plexus throughout the exercises. It is a lot of fun to do...it really is! This is a yoga you won't dread doing! The whole DVD(without doing the Breath and Posture Primer) took about one hour. The music is beautiful and peaceful.For those who like a detailed description, here it is. I hope you find it helpful. It starts with the usual TUNING-IN(chanting "ong namo guru dev namo"). Then onto:SOLAR POWER PART 1: 13 minutes 27 secondsyou start seated doing spinal grinds(moving your spine in a circle), neck rolls, then lying on your back with one leg raised doing Breath of Fire(rapid breath through the nose), a cat/cow(on your hands and knees) sequence, snaking cobra, and then sitting on your heels flexing the spine. Then on your heels knees wide; twisting from the torso.SOLAR POWER PART 2: 13 minutes 44 secondsyou are seated with legs extended doing some leg and hip stretches with breathing. Next are hip raises lying on your back, shoulderstand and plough with the Breath of Fire. And you also do a kind of sit-up but you lift your legs(bent) too.SET FOR SUPER VITALITY: 7 minutes 6 secondslying on your back with legs raised to 45 degrees, you criss-cross your legs. Then you do parallel bicycle to further work the abs. Then seated you raise your arms, hands interlaced, over your head with the Breath of Fire and then you place you hands behind you on opposite shoulders.AWAKEN YOUR SENSES: 15 minutes 38 secondsthis was my favorite sequence! About a third of the way through the exercise, I started to feel ready to stop(and started to feel like I was going to get angry at Ravi. lol), but then it made me feel like when I run on the beach with the ocean air and beautiful sights and sounds, I feel like I can run forever. So, it was incredible to have that feeling from this exercise. Then when it was time to stop I didn't want to! I felt so energetic and like going on. The exercise was done seated with your ring and little fingers curled under the thumb tip. Index and middle fingers pointing up. You alternate moving each arm forward with the Breath of Fire. Then after doing this for several minutes, you bring your arms up parallel to the floor, bent at the elbows. It was amazing.Then comes the DEEP RELAXATION: 5 minutes 10 seconds. It is so relaxing and restful.There is a HEART OPENING MANTRA CHANT for 4 minutes 30 seconds. It is "Ra-a Ma-a, Sa Sa Sa Sat, Hari Har Hari Har.Then it ends with the CLOSING PRAYER(2 minutes)There is a BREATH PRIMER AND POSTURE PRIMER and PRE-SETS:"QUICK SET FOR BEGINNERS(30 min.)"RISE AND SHINE"(58 min."SOLAR POWER EXPRESS"(50 min.)SPIRITUAL UPLIFT(43 min.)And of course, it has the MATRIX MENU OPTION for customizing your workout if you want.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Unlike some of the other reviewing folks, it didn't occur to me that this could be redundant to the navel power DVD. And I'm glad because I'm honestly never that psyched to do that particular disc. Just like some of the other reviewers, I am an avid fan of Ravi and Ana's DVDs. I've never been a fan of any particular yoga teacher or style in this way- previously I was the consummate dabbler, always jumping between styles and classes. This was mostly because I was unsatisfied. I loved yoga in many ways, but I often was unhappy while doing it- somehow, Ana and Ravi made kundalini yoga click for me- so do give it a shot, even if you've never done yoga before.That said, this is a great, relaxing disc. Even when I am lying on my back on the floor with my legs at a 45 degree angle doing scissors, or the 'yogic bicycle' exercise, I feel relaxed. I am amazed that I can work my midsection and still feel this calm about it!  And I love love love the long arm holds in Kundalini yoga. I used to hate them, but I reached a turning point one day and now I get a lot out of them, including improved arm strength, and adore the ones in this disc. The repetitive motions with hands held in a mudra, done while seated that this disc contains really do put you in a deeply meditative headspace.As for the brightly colored t-shirts, I found them distracting the first time I watched this DVD but now they make me happy. In the newer DVDs Ana looks to me even more like the picture of radiant yogic health! I love the way she presents kundalini yoga as not necessarily esoteric- spiritually transformative, yes, but not in a way that mandates special clothing. In her printed shirts she's like me doing my yoga. I suppose I would personally go for a solid color, wordless shirt if someone asked me opinion, but the RELAX shirt made me smile and remember to un-clench a bit more.But yes, I do love the happy dances Ana does at the end of some of the older DVDs, so bringing those back might not be a bad thing!If you're new to Ana and Ravi's discs I sincerely recommend checking out why they have such a devoted following!
summary: Feeling cheery while working the abs? Woah...

reviewText: I just got done doing this workout and I'm seriously buzzed! The reviewers before me did a great job of breaking down what's in these. I share their enthusiasm for everything about Ana & Ravi's 3 new titles. What I love about the Ana & Ravi DVD's is that they unabashedly work on things that you just won't find on other DVD's of the same genre. They are genius in terms of making sure you get a great workout but also in taking it a step further and working on things like glandular balance, emotional healing, relief from stress, and connecting with your higher self. Many other yoga teachers pay lip service to these concepts, and they are all sincere in their intentions, but Ana & Ravi take you there. They bring it down to earth somehow. You're always left feeling relaxed and energized, stretched, toned up, and inspired to live your life. Solar Power is truly masterful on so many levels. I just love doing it!

reviewText: I knew this one was going to be a favorite when I first read the description. I love to work on my solar plexus region because, as I have learned from my kundali practice, releasing the solar plexus is not only the secret to very toned abs but also to unlocking flexibility in the body. I learned in their Ultimate Stretch DVD (another favorite) that the body will not release until the solar plexus does and it works!!! So I am completely head over heels with Solar Power workout because it releases this region so nicely.Like in all their workouts it is a full body workout just like the DVD jacket says and nice that the focus of this one is the solar plexus. I am in heaven. I want to do it everyday but I also got Transformer so am switching them off with each other.I am in total bliss!!!!!!!!!.

reviewText: Sat Nam all,I am in the UK and have left a long and detailed review on amazon.co.uk for this DVD along with quite a few more of Ana and Ravi's DVD's including Fat free yoga, Beginners and beyond, Transformer and Super Radiance.  I won't go into great detail here as there are already some wonderful detailed reviews of what is on the dvd and how this class unfolds.What I would like to share with you is that I am drawn to this DVD class regularly and thoroughly enjoy and greatly benefit from it.  I love the production and beautiful background image, Ana is radiant and demonstrates the kriyas with ease.  The music is inspiring and helps me to 'keep up' with the class.  Ravi and Ana explain in a manner that is easy to understand and offer lots of encourgement.  I really like how the class flows, from the tune in, warm ups the solar power workout and relaxation and then onto the beautiful meditation with mantra and finally the tune out.Having completed this class I feel so calm and yet energised, blissful and yet capable...this is a wonderful and enjoyable class.  It is one of my favourites for sure.I had practiced hatha yoga for over a year prior to discovering Kundalini Yoga.  Kundalini Yoga is now my main practice (daily in the mornings) I have 'clicked' with Kundalini Yoga and feel so grateful to have it in my life, it has made such a difference.Thank you Ana and Ravi X

reviewText: I have been practicing Kundalini Yoga with Ravi and Ana for almost three years. The first day of my first practice began my journey towards improving my health, managing my emotions,surrendering to people and things that I have no control over, and on and on...After completing this DVD I feel so very full of joy, energy and serenity.The clarity of mind and soul is such a gift for which I am so grateful. On any given day, should I encounter others who appear rushed, upset,angry, etc.I am reminded of how my life used to be and I feel an absolute rush of gratitude and calm. My hope and prayer remains that sooner than later the Secret of attaining an entirely new and beautiful attitude towards life, and self be revealed.Today is lovely and I will remain present to accept the gifts of every moment.Thank you, thank you and thank you again Ravi and Ana.Namaste

reviewText: I have been teaching yoga myself for 7 years, and consider Ana and Ravi to be two of the most amazing teachers I've ever encountered. I love all of their DVDs. It's difficult to find words expressive enough to say how great they make me feel.Kundalini Yoga in the way that Ana and Ravi teach it leaves my body feeling fabulous, my mind refreshed, my spirits energized and high. This DVD is no exception - other reviewers have done a great job of explaining the different segments here, so let me just say that this DVD rocks. Kundalini Yoga may seem a little new or different to you if you're new to yoga or Kundalini, so just keep your mind open and see what your experience is. If you are open to just see how you feel, I suspect you might find what the other reviewers have found too - these DVDs are amazing. I find that the more I do Ana and Ravi's awesome practices, the more I can actually start to truly feel and live from the possibilities they talk about in their teaching. This DVD makes me feel more alive, joyful, energized and vibrantly healthy. If you are thinking at all about getting it, I urge you to give it a try - everyone deserves to feel this great!
summary: Want To Feel Amazing? - Get this DVD!

reviewText: Solar Power is a liberating workout! Because it opens the solar plexus and relaxes the diaphram, it makes all Raviana's other invigorating workouts that much more enjoyable. Note: Kundalini yoga is gentle but involves aerobic breathing and movements that unburden your body in the moment and long term.I'm a singer, and this DVD has helped me in enormous ways. For the record, ALL the kundalini yoga DVDs Raviana has put out are unique and powerful. I recommend owning the whole collection and choosing a different DVD every day, depending on your mood, time, and what you want to achieve! This is what I do :)As Ravi has put it in one of his DVDs: "This investment will pay dividends forever."
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a wonderful new DVD from Ana and Ravi!I have been doing KY with Ana and Ravi's practices for several years and there is not a single exercise activity I enjoy more. I have all their DVDs and they amaze me constantly, there is so much depth and joy in all of themThis new DVD  - Solar Power - is an excellent new addition! It's definitely very doable for all levels. I think people who look for more hatha-yoga like practices will really enjoy it - and there is definitely a lot of work aimed at stretching and opening - as well as a lot of Breath of Fire (love it).After the Intro and Tune-In, the Practice starts with Solar Power Part 1 and Solar Power Part 2 - they include some exercises we know and love form Ana and Ravi's previous DVDs - stomach grinds, neck circles, spinal flexes, cat cow, twists - and even an old favorite - hip joint release exercises also seen on Total Tune Up; shoulder stand, plow, hip raises, etc. Modifications are provided, all exercises are very pleasant, easy to do, enjoyable, none go for too long. A very, very enjoyable practice. It's lovely to hear Ana and Ravi explain the benefits of each exercise on both physical and emotional level.Next comes the Set For Super Vitality - Navel power exercises (leg raises and crisscross), some exercises sitting with arm work. Very interesting that during the abdominal exercises I really felt my deep abdominal muscles working - which is great - probably because we really opened up the solar plexus with previous sets.Awaken Your Senses follows - what a fun segment. First comes the exercise (we do it for a whole) where i felt like I was running while remaining seated, with breath of fire, and fingers are positioned in a special mudra. The exercise goes on for a bit, but it's really a lot of fun and doesn't tire any muscles too much, I felt like I could go on. Then another pose - seated with arms bent at the elbows. A very lovely seated silent meditation with gong follows.After a lovely Deep Relaxation we do a very beautiful Heart Opening Mantra - one would recognize it used as background music on other DVDs.There are some preset practices and the Matrix menu option allows for a customized workout.The set is the same as used on previous three releases - the backdrop of a lakefront, lush greens - very beautiful. The music is very solar - seriously, that's the word that springs to mind when the first song comes on. It can probably be described as traditional Indian ? - some instrumental, some vocal. I really miss Ana's singing.This DVD is excellent for anybody, there's absolutely nothing I didn't enjoy about it. It's very soothing yet energizing, calming and uplifting. I think students of all levels will enjoy it and benefit form it immensely.Ana's demonstrations make all exercises easy to learn, Ana looks very beautiful and radiant. The commentary by both Ana and Ravi is fantastic - I love Ana's opening words and Ravi's narration during the relaxation.Definitely a wonderful, 5-star practice all around, Ana and Ravi, thank you so much!

reviewText: I'm on a Kundalini Yoga kick and so I decided to buy this workout, even though I was disappointed in the previous workouts that used the same backdrop.This was a tough review to write since there many things I loved about this workout, but there were also many things that I didn't like.What I liked about this workout:* How it made me feel.  I felt so energized and happy.  I felt even more energized than with the other Ravi Ana Kundalini workouts.  It must be because of all that breath of fire.* The cool new music.  It was new agey and jazzy at the same time.  It wasn't quite what I would call "yoga" music, but it fit the workout.* The new poses.  Since I have all of Ravi Ana's other workouts, it's fun to have some new postures to try.* The return of some of my favorite poses:  the spine flexion and the hip raises while you hold your ankles are two of my favorites.* The core exercises weren't super tough, so I could really concentrate on focusing energy in my core, instead of struggling to do the exercises.* For several exercises, the explanation of what chakra they work and why they work it.  I just wish Ravi and Ana gave the explanations for some of the long, tiresome meditations. (See below.)* The breath and posture primer sections.  I love starting my Kundalini practices with breath of fire; this really helps get me centered.  I also love the posture primer since I sit hunched over a computer all day.What I didn't like about this workout:* The cheesy, fake background.  I loved the pure white background of earlier workouts. This one was distracting from the workout.* The sound quality.  Both Ravi and Ana sounded as though they were in an echo chamber.  I kept trying to just focus on the breathing and poses, but I couldn't stop being annoyed at the echoes.  Ravi and Ana have done enough DVD productions that this shouldn't happen.  Unless, this was deliberate.  In which case, I have no idea what purpose it served.* The choppy transition between sections.  The DVD would stop for a few seconds and then continue to the next section.  Ravi and Ana have been producing DVDs long enough so that this shouldn't happen.  To me, it's sloppy editing.* The long, and I mean long, exercises.  The worst was the one where you're sitting cross legged and moving your straight arms up and down to the breath of fire.  This goes on for 10 minutes.  I lasted about 4 minutes before I fast forwarded through the rest.  You then hold out your arms in a semi-goddess pose for several minutes.  I lasted about 1 minute with this pose. I understand that those exercises you dislike the most are the ones you probably need the most, but I just don't have the patience for these.  I wish Ravi had explained more what these exercises were supposed to do; perhaps then I would have tried to toughen it out.Since I loved the first few sections, I will probably do a premix of these and just skip the super-annoying parts.Because of the production annoyances and the painful long meditations, I give this workout 4 stars.

reviewText: This is a very solid Kundalini practice.  Although, the emphasis is on the solar plexus, there are also exercises that help detox, balance your energies, etc., so this is a good DVD to pull out when you want to cover many bases.  You can do the entire workout as it stands or use the Matrix to create your own practice, but there are also shorter pre-mixes on the DVD already made for you:  30-minute set for beginners, Rise & Shine at 58 minutes (my favorite), Solar Power Express at 50 minutes, and Spiritual Uplift which comes in at 43 minutes.  Although they include a short pre-mix for beginners, if you want to tackle the practice as a whole, you should probably be at least a solid intermediate in fitness as there are some challenging exercises.  The ending meditation is a Heart Opening chant.  Also, if you love breath of fire as much as I do, there is an abundant amount of it in this DVD practice.  The production quality is quite good with a really lovely set and distinctive music.  There are also primers for breath and posture.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This review will have a two-part format. In the first part, I'll describe the contents of the DVD as well as my thoughts on them. In the second part, I'll say some more general things about Ana and Ravi and kundalini yoga. It seems the negative reviews of their DVDs come mainly from people who didn't know what to expect when ordering kundalini yoga DVDs -- because they ARE a little bit different from what you're used to, if you've only practiced hatha yoga in the past. I am unabashedly an Ana and Ravi fan, but hopefully my evaluation will help you make the correct decision for yourself, even if your opinion happens not to be the same as mine.----------Part I----------Like most of Ana and Ravi's DVDs, Solar Power has the matrix menu, which allows you to customize the length of your workout. All exercises in this DVD are done equally on both sides of the body.Tune In (1:56): This segment is similar/the same in many of Ana's and Ravi's DVDs; you sit cross-legged, focus on your breathing, and chant "ong namo guru dev namo" three times.Solar Power Part 1 (13:27): This segment consists of the following exercises.  Note: the warm-up segment traditionally seen on Ana's and Ravi's DVDs is merged with the first solar power set here, so you can't select it separately from the matrix menu.  The music in this segment is slower and more subdued than what I've seen in some of Ana's and Ravi's other DVDs.*While seated, grind your stomach in circles*Head rolls*Lie down with your arms above you and one leg in the air; do breath of fire*A cat/cow series with different breath patterns*Snaking cobra, followed by cobra held in place*Sitting on knees, flex your spine forward and back*With your knees wide and your hands in bear grip, twist side to sideSolar Power Part 2 (13:44): This segment consists of the following exercises.  (The music is a little annoying here because it seems to be repeating on an endless loop.  There are no vocals.)*With one foot on your opposite thigh, bounce your knee; then cradle your calf in your arms and twist; finally, stretch your leg at a 45-degree angle in the air*Put one foot on your opposite thigh and lean forward*Hip raises*Shoulderstand*Plow*Repeat hip raises*Sit-ups to a V position with your knees bentSet for Super Vitality (7:06): This one will be killer on your inner thighs the first few times you do it.  It works the abs, too, but it was the thighs I noticed the next day!  This set consists of the following exercises.  The music here is rather slow, again, but has vocals.*On your back, raise your legs to a 45 degree angle and cross and uncross your calves*On your back, raise your legs to a 45 degree angle and alternate with one knee to the chest and the other leg extended*Seated, clasp your hands above your head with the palms up and do breath of fire*Seated, cross your hands behind your back with the palms on the shoulders and do breath of fireAwaken Your Senses (15:38): This is not my favorite segment, I'll be honest.  I feel pretty good about myself when I manage to do the whole thing without taking a break.  It definitely gets the energy moving.  This set consists of the following exercises.*Seated and with your hands in a mudra (hand position), move your arms forward and back like pistons (this segment lasts close to 10 minutes; I would've liked a bit more explanation about why it is done for so long)*Sit with your arms extended, elbows bent at a 90 degree angle and hands, again in a mudra, pointing up*Reasonably long (for Ana and Ravi) seated meditationDeep Relaxation (5:10): This is similar in many of Ravi's and Ana's DVDs. Lie on your back, slow your breathing, and listen to Ravi.  One thing I will say here is that I do not care for the music in this segment as I do not find it at all relaxing.  A gong is used rather a lot; this is not a sharp sound, at all, but kind of an extended metallic sound.  It's just a bit unsettling to me, but I try to work through it.Heart-Opening Mantra Chant (4:30): Sit cross-legged with your hands clasped and thumbs pointing up.  The mantra (Ra-a Ma-a Sa Sa Sa Sat Hari Har Hari Har) is sung.  Please note: this segment of the DVD is actually longer than 6 minutes, not the advertised 4:30, because Ana spends at least 2 minutes talking before the actual chant starts.  (The chant itself is about 4:30, though.)Closing Prayer (2:00): This is similar to what appears in other Ravi/Ana DVDs.Breath Primer: Please note that this segment may not play if you just play the entire DVD through. It is accessible from the matrix menu and the chapter selection menu, however. If you are not familiar with kundalini yoga, you will definitely want to follow along here. It's actually a pretty good refresher for anyone who has practiced for awhile, as well. You learn how to do a breath in eight parts (four equal parts breathing in and four equal parts breathing out), long deep breathing, a panting breath that serves as an introduction to breath of fire, and then a standard breath of fire technique.Posture Primer: This will also not play if you just play the entire DVD through, but is also accessible from the matrix menu and the chapter selection menu.  This is not a primer on any of the poses/asanas from the DVD, but rather a primer on having good posture, in general.For those of you familiar with Ravi's and Ana's DVDs, this is one of the newer ones with the concrete floor, white pillars, fake nature background, and blonde Ana. I've noticed a lot of the music in those overlaps (i.e. the gong shows up in Transformer, too). Both Ravi and Ana narrate and Ana demonstrates the poses and movements.I've been focusing mainly on the second solar power set because I have some issues with plantar fasciitis and tight hamstrings. I do this set first thing in the morning and it really helps me work out the stiffness and get moving. Actually, I'm doing that particular set because I e-mailed Ana and Ravi with a question about tight hamstrings and that's what they suggested - it stretches the hips and all up and down the legs, but the hip raises also strengthen the psoas muscle, which works in opposition to the hamstrings and creates more balance in that area (or at least, that's how I remember them explaining it to me).If you have done the Navel Power DVD that Ana and Ravi have put out, not to worry - there is not much (if anything) in the way of duplicated content.One warning: sometimes doing too much cat/cow every day, for a long period of time, can cause my wrists to hurt a bit. So if you have wrist issues, don't do the first solar power segment every day.I think this is probably not my very favorite DVD that Ravi and Ana have put out (I have about 2/3 of their DVDs), but I still rate it very highly. I actually think a lot of this DVD would be good for beginners (except Awaken Your Senses, which would be better for someone who was more advanced). Ana and Ravi do offer some suggestions for modifications of certain poses. I have to modify shoulderstand and plow, for example - both because I'm not flexible first thing in the morning and because I have an acid reflux problem that gets worse when I crush my stomach and esophagus.  (To modify shoulderstand, lie with your legs in the air or against a wall.  To modify plow, hug your knees into your chest.)  Finally, don't forget -- you don't have to keep up with Ana. Work at your own pace.Just to be clear, I think the yoga sets in this DVD are quite valuable.  I was not thrilled with the music, the length of the first move in Awaken Your Senses (without explanation as to why it was done for so long), and the amount of talking before the mantra chant.  I also wish the warm-up could be selected separately from the first solar power set.  But I still include this DVD as part of my regular rotation.----------Part II----------Now, on to a more general discussion of kundalini yoga in general, and Ana's and Ravi's DVDs in particular.  (I intend to include a version of this in all my reviews of Ana's and Ravi's DVDs.)Most of the yoga that people are familiar with falls under the umbrella of hatha yoga. Perhaps you've done a series of static poses, or some vinyasa/flow yoga. Kundalini yoga is not exactly like either of these, although Ana's and Ravi's DVDs do incorporate elements of hatha yoga (e.g., this DVD has cobra pose in it). However, kundalini yoga is also what I would consider to be a very active form of yoga, consisting of some repeated movements and a lot more work with the breath than you may be used to. It can be difficult to keep up with at first, but can be very rewarding if you stick with it. If you are bored of holding static poses all the time, or if you want a bit more movement but hate vinyasa (sorry, but I am not a fan of flow yoga), kundalini might really work well for you. And, as I said earlier, use the modifications Ana and Ravi discuss if you need to use them. Yes, Ana is fit (and this makes her an excellent demonstrator for the poses), but this is not a competition. Don't strain yourself, and don't try to keep up with her. Just try to improve a little bit every time!Kundalini yoga also involves a lot of meditation. Sometimes this is quiet and involves breathing either in a sitting position or lying down, occasionally with your hands in a mudra (hand position). Sometimes it involves chanting a mantra. This DVD contains a fair amount of mantra chanting - there's the separate chanting segment, as well as the opening and closing segments. Whenever there are mantras, Ana and Ravi tell you what they mean. If you are uncomfortable with mantras for religious reasons, check out Ana's and Ravi's website (can't post links in reviews but they're easy to find through Google) for alternatives and use the matrix menu or your DVD remote to skip the chant.  (I happen to like the chants, but that's just me.)With respect to calorie-burning, this is probably not the sort of program that will make you shed a ton of weight. What it is good for, is improving your flexibility and strengthening your core. And as a physical activity, it does burn some calories and strengthen some parts of your body. But kundalini yoga works on your inner self as well as your outer self, and so some parts are a little less "active" than others. For my own part, I still do plenty of pretty intense cardio at other times of the day.Ana's outfits are a bit skimpy, but certainly nothing less than you would see at the beach. And the reason she dresses like she does is so that you can really see her performing the movements and asanas. That way you know exactly how to position yourself for maximum benefit. (Most of the time, kundalini yoga is done with the eyes closed, anyway.) There is not a lot in the way of initial instruction in this DVD. If you are familiar with Ana's and Ravi's work, you can jump right in. But if you are new to kundalini yoga, watch it first. Observe Ana, listen to the cues, make sure you understand. You'll be glad for the lack of excessive instruction later -- you don't want to be told on the 20th time you do a DVD how to do cobra; you know it by this point!Some health claims are made in this DVD. Take those with a grain of salt. I find that Ana and Ravi are quite accurate when it comes to muscular and skeletal issues (like my tight hamstrings). I don't know that I believe everything they say about, say, the thyroid, for example. Perhaps that's my Ph.D. in chemistry intruding. At any rate, certainly don't use yoga as a substitute for seeing the doctor. But doing a routine like this isn't likely to hurt you or make your health condition worse (as long as you PACE YOURSELF).If you are struggling with a pose, Ravi and Ana are very accessible and quite nice. They have contact information on their website (the URL is on the DVD case) and usually get back to you in a couple of days. They also have a monthly e-mail newsletter that I enjoy.
summary: excellent yoga sets, not as thrilled with the music in this one

reviewText: I love Solar Power workout!!!!!! What a great practice! It's the perfect balance of strength work, stretching, core work, upper body work, and spiritual and emotional work! Overall, its very aerobic too, while being completely non-impact. That is the beauty of Kundalini Yoga! I also really love the premixes on all 3 of these new ones. I own & love almost every dvd/video Ana & Ravi have made and these 3 new ones are their best to date!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had to double-check the back of the DVD case after I finished, because this definitely didn't feel like a 70-minute workout! It went by so fast, and was completely enjoyable. I already owned the Navel Power workout and I thought they might overlap or be similar but they really aren't--in fact they are complimentary!At times I felt like the music overwhelmed the voiceover instructions, but they were always audible. That's really the only thing I'd change, would be making the music softer when someone is speaking. But the workout itself is wonderful, and I can't wait to do it again!
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: Check out the reveiws before this one for wonderful and complete content details.  They are important and well written.I, on Sundays, usually have a little extra time for my yoga practice. What I love about this (and all Ravi/Ana DVD's) is that on this particular Sunday, I felt like going for it...candles, solitude, the works.  Starting with the Tune-in and then warm-ups, I then moved on the Solar-Power I/II, Super Vitality and then Awaken your Senses.  In order to lengthen my practice and enjoy my "me" time, I repeated the Solar Powers and Awaken Your Senses Segments.  It may sound like a lot, but once I got into the mood, I didn't want to stop.  Every asana is uplifting and encouraging.  Having this time to devote to myself is essential to my stress reduction.After the energizing segments, I moved on to the Heart Opening Mantra which is beautifully sung.  I always end with deep relaxation (which I feel renews and heals) and finalze everything with the closing prayer.  It was such a wonderful morning...after that, the rest of the day is grand ;-)
summary: Worked on my Solor Power for 90 great minutes!

reviewText: My boyfirend and I adore these new workouts. Have been working with this one for a week. We love it. Absolutely flawless from start to finish.  We love, love, love, the way the poses flow so effortlessly from one to the other. And love to try to imitate Anas amazing boneless snaking cobra but end up collapsing in giggles! Mostly we love the blissful feeling it leaves us with. I am so happy to be sleeping peacefully again now that I am back to my regular Kundalini yoga practice!
